inn1.comm: gentle start all round, nothing like the madness of the start against India. This is floated up wide outside off stump and even Tamim is happy to have a sighter
slightly close to off stump this time, no great pace, Tamim flashes a mistimed drive to cover. The crowd crescendo thinking it was more
touch shorter here, straighter too from Rankin and Tamim pops up on his toes to dab back to the bowler
Tamim is away, Bangladesh are away. Touch too short this time, leg side too and Tamim with a flick of the wrists sends it running down to fine leg
don't bowl there, not on this pitch, not to Tamim! Floated up full and wide and Tamim dismissed it. Flowing blade sending it skimming to the rope at point
have all of that! This wasn't even a bad ball. Straight on a length, Tamim rocked forward and punched a drive down the ground, mid-off had no chance as it sped to the rope

ooh, four more but Kayes had no idea where this was. Outside off stump and Kayes threw his bat  at it, flew off the inside edge, past the stumps and away to the boundary. No ball too, so free hit time
as is the case so often, the free hit is underwhelming as Kayes gets down on one knee and hurls this to midwicket
Johnston has found his line and length this time and it keeps a little low which means Tamim jabs his defence down
no great pace but a tight line and length which brings a valuable dot ball for Johnston
hint of width allows Tamim to drive, but it's a careful shot and finds cover
just a fraction too close to the pads and Tamim takes full toll. Flicks of the wrists, nothing more than that and it hurtles through the square leg region
decent ball to finish, back of a length around off stump. Tamim gets back to try and punch a drive but can't get any power on the shot
better delivery to start this Rankin over. On a length around off stump, the ball slides off a thick edge down to third man
wow, Tamim is in the mood! Slower ball wide of off, Tamim didn't bother moving his feet much, just swung through the line and nailed it over mid-off
better ball, width is fatal so the line has to be here - around off stump - Tamim blocks, against all his will
ah lovely shot, taken from around middle-and-off and whipped through midwicket
good line and length to Kayes, and compact defence
width is a dangerous thing for a bowler. Kayes has the chance to free his arms and eases his blade through the line, hurtles off to the point boundary. Whirlwind start for Bangladesh
carefully defended into the off side
catch that, if you dare! Length ball that Tamim hammers back airily in the direction of the bowler, who had barely got his arm up by the time the ball and dented the advertising hoarding
four more! This is electrifying. More edge than middle but Tamim won't care, he's flying now. Flashes at some width and it flies off a top edge through fine third man
better line and length and punched to short cover
carefully blocked this time. Tamim has earned the right to block a few
like all the best batsmen in the right mood, Tamim keeps the strike off the last ball of the over. Flicking to deep square
gentle but accurate start, around off stump. Tamim whips it hard to deep midwicket
Kayes hangs deep in his crease to work a single to midwicket to bring Tamim back on strike. Decent start from Mooney

oh dear, with fine leg up this is no place to be bowling. A gift for Tamim. Shortish and outside leg stump, all Tamim needed to do was get a bat on it and he got plenty of it, flicking his seventh boundary
leg-sided again and Tamim collects a couple working fine of square leg
full and straight to finish another painful Ireland over. Not quite sure what you do with Tamim in this mood, perhaps gamble with the gold that this Dockrell
Johnston finds a length and off stump line, which has been all too rare so far, Kayes punches a drive to point where Porterfield fields smartly
again it's a good delivery that Kayes can only push to cover
hat trick of dot balls! Huge achievement given the way this morning has gone. Kayes picks out midwicket with a work to leg
not exactly where Kayes wanted but this slides off the outer half of the bat to run down to third man and bring up Bangladesh's 50 - off 35 balls. Breathless stuff
this is turning out to be a decent over for Ireland, Tamim nudges a single to deep square. Can Johnston finish well?...
...just about. The line was wrong - outside leg - but Kayes couldn't get hold of it
Mooney finds a fullish length and middle-stump line and Tamim blocks hard back to him
good shot for one this, flicked hard off middle through midwicket
Kayes tries to repeat the shot but doesn't quite time it as well

stunning work from O'Brien behind the sticks! Absolute lightening and the crowd is dumbstruck. Complete shock and silence as Kayes tries to flick to leg, overbalances momentarily and O'Brien makes a leg-side stumping look easy. Much, much needed for Ireland and the wicket has come through a moment of inspiration from one of their best
difficult to convey just how quiet it's gone in the stadium. Like 30,000 people have drained away in a flash. This is full and straight and blocked back to the bowler
more careful defence from Junaid here
the second good over in a row ends with Junaid blocking to point. The blaring music and Irish chatter is all you can hear at the ground at the moment
Johnston finds an off stump line, he also finds the middle of Tamim's bat but it goes straight to cover
back of a length and Tamim offers the straightest of blades in defence
much fuller this time, almost yorker length, turned to deep midwicket for a quiet single
Junaid is away, full-facing a single down the ground
the pitch seems a touch slow and Tamim's back-foot punch finds cover here
given this was a shin-high full toss Johnston is luck to get away wit it. Quietly prodded to deep square. Decent mini-period for the Irish here
just another single, worked off the pads to deep square
oops, what happened here? Full toss - slower ball - that Junaid swung at and missed and it went through the keeper for a couple
more legitimate runs this time, punched hard into space for a couple
good work from Mooney, finding a straightish line back of a length  and it's blocked back to the bowler

he's gone! None of the fielders looked that interested first up but some lazy running from Junaid has cost him his wicket. Mistimed a drive to mid-off and looked to skulk a single, Ed Joyce's throw hit direct and Junaid was a fraction short of his ground
touch of width here but Tamim is more circumspect after the wickets and stabs this to point
starts well enough, around off stump and Mushfiqur pushes into the off side
again Mushfiqur is forward, this time inside-edging a drive to mid-on
Mushfiqur is away, courtesy of a misfield at point that allows him to jog a single
no pace on the ball whatsoever. This makes Collingwood look rapid, and Tamim is less than impressed as he mistimes a cut
just a single here, no pace for Tamim to work with and it's nudged around the corner
oh dear, five good balls and all the pressure is released with a bad delivery. With fine leg up in the circle it's down the leg side and Mushfiqur flicks his first boundary
chopped hard to point, but can't beat the field
tidy work, hitting a good line and length
worked calmly up to mid-off, precious dot-balls these ...
Mooney is working to a good field. Hitting a line on off and angling away. Tamim defends to short cover
slightly too straight, and angled wide of midwicket for a single
on the pads, tucked off the toes to midwicket. A very tidy over
the silence is absolutely deafening, as Tamim drives a bit lazily outside off stump, and the skipper Porterfield leans forward at point to take the most crucial wicket of the day so far!
on the toes, flicked to square leg
Shakib stands tall on the back foot to drive into the covers
a swish from deep in the crease, midwicket tidies up without alarm
sweet shot, just a fraction over-pitched, and Shakib leant into a straight drive, all weight transferral, minimum power. Nice
pushed down to long-off to complete the over. This is nip-and-tuck now!
stands tall again, punched off the back foot
chopped from a flat-footed stance, out to short cover
a full-toss on the toes, whisked around the corner, no-one was going to cut that off. A gift
clipped into the leg side once again, this pair need to go deep into the innings now
shuffles back and across, and defends in front of off. Slow, slow delivery once that had pitched
nudged out to point, that's another over gone
defended out to midwicket, good discipline from Ireland's bowlers
defended off the back foot again
short, and a bit loose, carved greedily into the covers but smart fielding intercepts
down the leg side
driven down the ground, no great pace on the ball or the shot. Long-off tidies up
big stride forward (relatively speaking) and poked to point. Fuller length that time

worked off the toes, and picked up at midwicket. And the Manhatten graph shows how well Ireland have done since those early overs. It was 10 an over for the first four. Barely four an over for last 10
that's four of them already ... the extra pace, and extra bounce, work in the batsman's favour. Enough width to attack and that streaks through point
punched off the back foot, sharp fielding in the covers again. Ireland have been tigerish, to borrow their opponents' favourite animal
a chopped cut shot, straight to the fielder at point
round the wicket, and Rankin overcompensates with the angle, that fizzes down leg
defended out to midwicket, a hip-high delivery

dropped! Just when I was praising their fielding, Porterfield drops a clanger at point! A regulation cut, it seemed to reach him before he was set, and the chance was lost ... his reaction suggests he never saw it out of the crowd.
nurdled out to point
cautious from Shakib

now then, now then! This is a massive wicket! Shakib can't make his lifeline count, as he is beaten for lack of pace off the pitch, plays too early off the back foot and spoons a simple return catch to the bowler!
starts with a textbook defence
again less than no pace to work with, these a dream conditions for the Irish
carefully pushed back into the off side
wicket maiden. The crowd are stunned, pin-drop silence
pace on the ball with Rankin, he just needs to find a length and line after a shocking start. This is okay, Mushfiqur up on his toes to defend
too much width this time, allows Mushfiqur to work down to third man
fuller and straighter and nothing Mushfiqur can do but defend
Rankin digs this in and the ball almost stops on landing. Mushfiqur could have played about three shots before the ball arrived
very full, very straight and bunted back to the bowler
good over, Bangladesh are really on the mat now. Driven without much intent or timing to cover
wonderful start, thrown up, dipping, landing around off stump and defended carefully
excellent length and line again, nothing for the batsman but defence
first the flight, now the turn! Ripper from Dockrell, landing around leg and spinning towards the outside edge
touch shorter this time but Mushfiqur can't time his cut shot
back to a fullish length, touch of flight from an easy action, careful defence once more
maiden over to begin Dockrell's World Cup career. Excellent over it was too. The man will be an England legend in no time
starts as well as he was from the other end. No pace, around middle, attempted work to leg doesn't connect
(even) slower ball, picked off for a single to the leg side. Really sticks in the pitch. 230 will be a tough chase
run down to third man here
back of a length, tucking the batsman up for space and it's prodded back to the bowler
precious little timing for Raqibul, how long ago those opening five overs seem. Milked down the ground for a single
Mushfiqur really taking his time, trying to rebuild this innings but he needs to work some singles
touch too short from Dockrell, Raqibul rocks back but picks out cover with his drive
first run off Dockrell, turned into the leg side
touch too short again and Mushfiqur cuts to deep point
just been a bit short this over Dockrell. Raqibul deep in his crease to defend
single picked off into space, again Raqibul playing off the back foot
ah, that Mushfiqur sweep! Down low and smashing a sweep to deep midwicket
excellent defensive work from Botha, he dreams of pudding pitches like this, nothing for Raqibul to work with
again the line is good, the length is good, the pitch is slow, what's Raqibul to do?
boundary, precious boundary! Overpitched and Raqibul leant into a drive, timing on this track against an old ball is no mean feat, but he did it beautifully
the boundary is followed by a single, worked into space
back of a length and Mushfiqur is unable to get much on it
touch too short and too much room as well. Mushfiqur times a cut shot nicely and it speeds out to deep point
being all of 4ft high, Mushfiqur can play plenty off the back foot and punches down the ground
again Mushfiqur is back and finding space to unfurl a cut shot to deep point
better length from the Doctor, Raqibul picks out the infield in defence
Raqibul will be disappointed with this, missing out on a shortish wide ball
driven firmly wide of the bowler, who, despite a dive and plenty of imploring from the keeper, could not get hold of it
not a great start to the new spell, fired down the leg side. Worked to fine leg for an easy single
no bounce here and Mushfiqur, hanging on the crease, has to jab his bat down in defence
hint of width but it keeps low and finds the toe-end of a flat-footed slash outside off stump
very straight, good length too and Mushfiqur's punch is neatly collected by the bowler
enough room to flash a cut shot out to deep point
blocked back to the bowler to end a good comeback over for Johnston
ah spin here for Dockrell, enough to check the drive from Mushfiqur
Mushfiqur is down on the sweep and almost makes a hash of it as it bobbles off a flurry of arms and bat
"down, down!" screams O'Brien. Despite a dive Dockrell couldn't reach it though and a single milked back past him
this is worked into space for another single
lovely delivery, some flight and dip, hint of spin and Mushfiqur very respectful in defence
batsman will be annoyed with this. Dragged down a touch short but the lack of pace in the pitch meant the cut shot came off the toe-end and trickled to point
Johnston continues with a good line and length and nothing the batsman can do but defend
slower ball here, genuine offspinner, doesn't do much off the pitch though but another dot ball clocked up
overpitched and the crowd goes wild as a drive finds deep cover. Fair to say the supporters haven't had much to cheer of late
more noise from the crowd as this is driven square of the wicket on the off side
another single, good work from these two this over, flicked around the corner
four singles in a row as the over ends by Mushfiqur turning his hands over the ball to send it to deep square. Good work
anyway, with the new ball Dockrell finds a typically good length and line and is prodded into the leg side
picked off to midwicket, neatly played
good flight here, accurate as well and it's milked down the ground
poor delivery, far too short but the bounce is so low and the pitch so slow that it seems impossible to find the boundary
worked into the leg side for another single. Decent stuff from bowler and batsman
good ball to finish a good over, thrown up, hint of spin, blocked to mid-off
starts well, back of a length around off stump and blocked to point
exactly the same length and line and nothing for the batsman to work with
touch wider this time but the batsman bottom-edges the cut shot and it dribbles out on the off side
very good over so far, Raqibul pushing back to the bowler
after four good balls this is a touch too wide and Raqibul crisply punched it through extra cover
short ball to finish, dragged from outside off down wide of mid-on
decent, gentle offspin to start. Around middle, not much spin, turned gently into the leg side
fuller and driven very firmly, good shot too, wide of cover point
mowed hard, Mushfiqur loves that sweep shot, but it goes straight to midwicket
pushed quietly back out on the off side
squeezed off the front foot and it squirts wide of point for a single
another single to end a decent introductory over for Striling
these two are beginning to rotate the strike nicely now. Single taken down the ground from a back-foot drive
back of a length and cut hard, but straight to point
driven without much timing to mid-on, who scoots round to field sharply
another dot ball, pressure building as this firm cut shot is excellently intercepted at point
that will make Mushfiqur feel better, gets a full ball on his pads and whips a couple straight of midwicket
another good Irish over ticks by with defence. These two can carry on prodding and taking what singles are on offer until the 38th over I imagine
worked into the square-leg region
driven hard and back at the bowler, the mid-off is deeply set and runs around quickly to field
another single prodded to the leg side
very flat and on the pads, the batsman uses the angle to push into the leg side
Raqibul deep into his crease and pushed back to down the ground
carefully worked into space to end a good over of singles for Bangladesh
flicked down to long-on
pushed out to cover
nurdled down to third man
cunning improvisation from the Mighty Atom! Across the crease, down on one knee, and flicked over fine leg for Bangladesh's first boundary in ten overs
good line and length, right on the money, defended
stands tall, deep in the crease, and driven out to midwicket
good flight and bite, nudged down to third man
good use of the feet, driven into the covers
tucked off the toes to wide mid-on. Singles are the currency at the moment
flicked square
held back in the flight, Mushfiqur shuffled in his crease, and worked down to third man
another very tidy over, just four coming from it, and Ireland maintain control
good delivery, inswinging and yorker-length, drilled back to the bowler
O'Brien's got this ball going a bit, a hint of reverse maybe. And a hint of an appeal too. Going down, and bat involved. Otherwise close
shuffled out to third man
full length once again, and definite late movement. This promises to be a very useful spell
good shape again, a fraction of width allows Raqibul to go for his stroke, but more sharp fielding in the covers
driven down to long-on, tidy stuff
round the wicket, pitches middle and leg, and straightens. Defended
good use of the feet, and driven down to long-off
Dockrell strikes! The teenager makes the breakthrough, and it's a poor stroke. An injudicious sweep, against the spin, an easy top-edge, and the man on the 45 backpedals to swallow a sitter
forward and prodded determinedly back down the track
really reaching for the ball with hard hands, it's not a hand grenade, honest
blocked in a don't-you-dare-come-near-me style. Relax, it's only the World Cup!
worked off the back foot, out to point
good line and length to complement the extra pace
short and sharp, good delivery and a poor stroke, a lofted pull into space on the leg-side. Very high on the bat, and plugs between two fielders!
outside off, a swish and a miss
clipped down to fine leg
a slip is in place for Ashraful, who gets off the mark with a cautious nudge
loopy doopy stuff from Dockrell, so slow it barely reaches the bottom end. Ashraful swishes urgently into the covers
gah. Down on one knee, patted to backward square. A carbon copy of the Mushfiqur dismissal. And another failure for the erratic Ash
a swish, and a miss
clocked out to deep cover
good footwork, dancing in the crease and driven wide of point
defended out to the off side. Another drip-fed over from Dockrell
short and smackable, but no wood on that shot
driven to mid-on
good attacking line, wider on the crease and aiming at the stumps. Defended to cover
flicked off the hip
turned to backward square with a flick of the wrists. Another single to the cause
short, and pulled hard out to midwicket
super flight and bite from Dockrell, landing on a sixpence and zipping past the edge
fractionally shorter, and pushed out to point
forward and blocked
blocked into the covers for a single
defended again
Raqibul finally uses his feet, but only to defend a single to mid-off

not even in the frame! Pushed to mid-on, aggressive fielding, one-handed pick up and under-arm and Raqibul has to go! Replays show he was at least two feets short of the crease, another careless way to go, and Ireland have this game by the scruff now
much needed boundary, but it's needed a horrid misfield from Johnston to get it, sliding to the ball and letting it through him
this is driven hard, but straight to mid-off
big swish outside off stump, big miss too
flash outside off stump again, this time there is an edge but with no slip in place it flies away for another boundary. Poor old Rankin is having a tough game
Dockrell to bowl out then, throws this one up, lands it one a perfect length and line and quietly defended
again the length is good, again the line is good, again the flight is good. What's a batsman to do
Shafiul hanging back and swishing without much fortune outside off
ooh, lucky here for the batsman as he swishes hard, bottom edges and the ball goes this far over the stumps
Dockrell finishes an excellent spell as he started, with a maiden. He's a hugely promising young man and no doubt the England selectors will be keeping an eye!
lovely shot earns a single and a cheer from the beleaguered crowd, punching past extra cover
Shafiul looks a little stuck here. Rooted to the crease and prodding to point, needs to find a way to get Naeem on strike
again this is steered without much footwork or intent to the point fielder
more careful, nothing defence. Good work from Botha and precious deliveries ticking by
finally the single is taken, driven to mid-off for a sharp single. Naeem will want the strike though so needs a single here
can't find it, short of a length, no pace on the ball and driven straight to mid-off
starts well enough, around off stump, not much Shafiul can do
again the line is good and Shafiul doesn't look like working a single
prodded into the leg side
finally Shafiul is away from strike, shovelling this into the midwicket region
plenty of screams and shouts as Naeem thinks about a single before deciding against it to mid-on
far too easy for Stirling, this is shoved down the leg side but Naeem misses out which means Shafiul has the strike next over
Botha is full and straight and Shafiul merely stabs it to point
the crowd beginning to get impatient now, understandably. Shafiul again with a perfect defence

Shafiul's torturous innings ends as he pops forward and plays around a straight ball. He called for a review but it only confirmed the worst, heading half-way up leg stump. Three wickets now for Botha, all he's done is bowl straight
gets off the mark with a couple into the leg side
on off stump and defended into the off side
on the stumps and he can't get it away
it's been very hard to get the ball away with no pace to work with
opens the face and tries to beat backward point but can't...more pressure building
finally finds a gap, worked into the leg side out to deep square
tossed up from round the wicket, pushed firmly out to midwicket
touch shorter and he rocks onto the back foot but can only whip it straight to the midwicket man again
Botha bustles in, lands it back of a length around middle and nowhere for the batsman to go
yeesh, this slower ball almost didn't reach the batsman. He had to wait and wait before pushing gently out to cover
carefully threaded through the infield, just a single but Bangladesh will take that now now
edge, precious useful edge means this speeds down to third man where Johnston runs around to cut off without alarm this time

finally a big shot attempted, Razzak clearing his front leg and slogging, didn't get all of it and it looped down to deep cover where White slid round and kicked the ball to safety just inside the rope. Smartly done
back of a length is the response and it's a good one. Naeem up on his toes trying to squeeze this away but can't
oh dear, how has Razzak missed that!? Gift short and wide outside off stump, but the flat-footed slash missed
this time Johnston is back on a line and length, slower ball too, and it's forced to mid-on, the batsman injecting all the pace on that
it's full and straight and cut off at cover before a really silly shy at the stumps allows a single
again the delivery is good, very full, Razzak whips it to deep midwicket but there is a fielder out there
the line slips a fraction down leg and it allows Naeem to clip a couple straight of deep midwicket. The crowd are in full voice, urging something from their team
good work from Naeem, keeps the strike by dinking a single to cover and haring off for a sharp single. Just four good overs and Bangladesh will feel right in this
decent enough start for the "tall figure" of Rankin. Flicked around the corner for a single
ooh, the bowler is lucky here, too short, too wide and a flashing cut found cover. Rankin really hasn't gone well today
floated up very full and very wide. Too wide for the umpire's liking. Razzak aimed an almighty thwack but couldn't reach it

this is a much better delivery, very full, hit Razzak on the full. Given out straight away but review called and replays show it missing off stump! The crowd have gone absolutely mental! You'd think Razzak had just hit his fourth six in a row!
another long appeal from Rankin here, this was definitely not out though. Full outside off, Razzak aimed a heave-ho and missed by a distance
far too wide here, miles outside off stump
Razzak would have wanted more here, full toss outside off stump but it slides off the edge to deep point
Rankin's line is wrong again but it only costs a single as Naeem clips to deep square to keep the strike
another full toss but again the batsmen can't cash it. Leg stump this time as well, but worked to midwicket
three full tosses in a row, at least this was struck hard. Straight to the man at the boundary though, who slides well at deep midwicket to keep this to one
back of a length, Naeem cuts hard but picks out cover
big, walking appeal from Niall O'Brien as Naeem flashes and misses outside off stump. Think the sound was bat hitting ground though
Johnston lands the yorker which is bunted out to mid-off. It's tight bowling but the batsmen are not trying anything here

another one goes. Razzak at least trying to  up the pace. Slower ball and he's through a leg-side slug far too early, canons off the back pad onto the stumps. Can Bangladesh even reach 200? What a disappointing showing it's been

what on earth is Rankin doing. He's completely lost his line and shoved this a mile down the leg side, the keeper couldn't collect and it was only some sliding fielding from Johnston that prevented five wides. Not sure Rankin was the best option here
there we go, that's> the place to bowl. Back of a length and straight and defended carefully
bit fuller this time, the line is key and it's straight. Naeem blocks back to the bowler
too much width outside off this time, Naeem slices down towards third man and scampers hard for a couple
single fiddled into the leg side. Ireland will at least need 200 now. Rubel  has to survive these two deliveries
he didn't know much about it but Rubel is off strike. Aimed to work it to leg and it came off towards point, they ran the single that brings up the Bangladesh 200
he didn't know much about it but Rubel is off strike. Aimed to work it to leg and it came off towards point, they ran the single that brings up the Bangladesh 200
Rubel does exactly what he needed to, getting the single first ball to bring Naeem back on strike, driving a full ball to cover
that will be all, Naeem trying something inventive, which is no bad thing, getting down on one knee to scoop over short fine leg, gets too much bat on it and it loops straight to the man.

inn2.comm: that's very wide to start with, pushed across the left hander and it's an easy call for the umpire
much better line, on off stump and it's met with a punchy drive that finds cover
full outside off and this time a square drive finds the gap between cover and backward point
ooh, good comeback as he drags the length a touch shorter and the ball zips past the outside edge...not much carry
on middle and off, he plays around his front pad a touch but middles a drive to mid-on
bringing him onto the front foot again and the drive finds mid-off...the pitch-up route can go for runs, but he could also find the edge
touch wider and he throws his hands through the line, the ball flies off a thick outside edge down to third man
over the wicket, on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
on the back foot and he pushes out to midwicket
pushed towards leg stump but Porterfield's flick can't beat square leg
a little shorter and this time he finds the gap on the leg side then the fielder manages to kick the ball away for a second run
flatter ball which is pushes easily down to long on
round the wicket, on off stump and Stirling defends on the front foot
worked into the leg side, can't find the gap
ooh, nearly, as a quicker ball skids off the surface and finds the inside edge into the leg side
very full and dug out back down the pitch
dragged down short and wide, hammered into the covers where it's fumbled again to allow a couple
real lack of bounce as this one is popped back down the pitch
onto the front foot and an inside goes into the leg side
pushed towards leg stump, worked behind square on the leg side and short fine-leg keeps them to a single
stays in the crease and works into the leg side
boy, that was tossed up miles, almost came down with snow on it and Porterfield plays over the top and nearly gets bowled
worked down the ground
outside off stump, defended with bat and pad together into the off side

dropped oh dear, not great cricket all round. Was dragged down very short, Stirling rocked back for the pull and picked out Raqibul at short midwicket who couldn't hang on. To be fair, he's very close and it was flying
full on off stump, Stirling comes onto the front foot and whips it down to long on
round the wicket and Porterfield plays a neat drive down the ground
very full and he manages to force it away through midwicket out to the sweeper
nicely bowled, that straightened a touch from middle stump and is played into the off side
goes back deep into the crease and drives down to long off
neatly worked into the leg side...steady start from both sides
that's a cracking sweep, he came right across his crease and took the ball from outside leg stump down to backwards square
on the pads but he finds the fielder at square leg

gone! Bangladesh have the breakthrough and the crowd goes wild. A very full delivery almost yorked Stirling, he jabs down on it and it dribbles from his boot back towards Rahim. The batsman, meanwhile, has stumbled out of the crease and can't get back as the stumps are broken. The TV umpire is called but it was an easy decision
gets a leading edge along the ground into the off side
defends solidly to the off side
full on off stump and patted back towards the bowler
bowled from very wide of the crease around the wicket, pushed into the leg side
tossed up on middle and off, defended to the off side
onto the front foot and he drives down to long off
angled towards leg stump, Joyce waits on the back foot and works it out to deep square
tossed up again round the wicket, Porterfield plays a well-controlled drive through the off side which goes wide of long off
dragged down short this time and it's put away by Porterfield with a strong back-foot drive which beats deep cover and long off. Good placement
outside off stump, Joyce onto the front foot and defends square on the off side
short again outside off, Joyce cracks it into the off side but a good dive at cover saves the possible boundary
drifts to leg stump this time but Joyce can't put it away as he finds square leg
flatter outside off stump and it's nicely steered away through backward point... was fully controlled and all along the ground, needed a slide by the fielder to prevent a boundary
this is very calm batting by Joyce as he places this one down to long on
quicker on off stump, pushed into the covers and there's almost a mix-up as cover sprints in but Porterfield as able to get back in time
pushed in at middle and leg, worked out to midwicket
more air on this one and again midwicket is in action
defended back down the pitch
leans forward and drives but mid-off is inside the circle
ooh, he nearly gets through with one that doesn't bounce much but Joyce is quickly down on it
lots of air, comes out as a full toss but Joyce can only find mid-on. He missed out there and it completes a maiden

gone! And he strikes first ball. Massive moment in the game. Coming round the wicket, it was a touch short on leg stump but Porterfield goes back and flicks it straight to Raqibul at midwicket. He wasn't going to drop this one.
stays round the wicket, O'Brien onto the front foot and plays into the covers
short outside off, O'Brien skips onto the back foot and cuts it away through the off side...that will calm Ireland a little
better line and length, this one bounces a touch more and almost has O'Brien in a tangle as he drives to force into the off side
big appeal, switched to over the wicket and strikes the pad but he's got a decent stride in and looks a fraction outside off
argh, poor ball to end the over...short again outside off and that's easy pickings for O'Brien as he punishes it through the off side
tweaker, angling into the pads from outside off, defended
pushed into the covers with a deadly-straight bat
scampered single for a push to mid-on, dicey but safe
width outside off stump, but an attempted slap is under-edged to  cover
low full-toss, driven hard, but straight back to the bowler
cut hard out to point
cut uppishly, and bounces short of point
forward and defended
driven into the covers, full stride
misdirected, down the leg side
slightly shorter, sits up and is cut hard into the covers
full length, tries to steer down to third man, but the ball bobbles down into the crease
pierces the gap with a full-faced stroke. Placement over power
fully forward, well struck but more good fielding in the covers to cut off the run
nearly a mix-up as Shakib swooped, but Joyce was sent back in good time
forward and pushed to cover
turned off the toes to square leg, another single
big stride forward, Ireland are biding their time. Another over ticks by
big stride forward, punched back to the bowler
slightly misdirected, flicked down the leg-side
open-faced steer, using the width, and there's a gutsy piece of fielding at third man to rescue the boundary
forward and defended into the covers
text-book defence to see off the over
looped onto the toes from round the wicket, defended to cover
tossed up into the blockhole, driven down to long-off
makes a touch of room to fillet a cut to deep point
a similar stroke to return the compliment. Singles will suffice for now
on the toes, wheedled into the leg side
driven, hard, that was the four-ball. But it hits short cover and ends up a dot
wristy drive out to deep point. Joyce already looks happier with pace to work with
cracking delivery, excellent line, hint of late movement, and O'Brien is well beaten
probing the off stump, good bowling
back of a length, aiming for top of off. Good discipline and defended off the back foot
solidly struck, but the line and length is immaculate, and there's nothing to work with. Cover tidies up
struck hard again, into the covers, but that's an excellent over. Keeping up the pressure and hunting for the edge
decent line, a fraction short, but watchfully steered to point
on the pads, and mid-on had to swoop quickly to intercept. Another single
too much width, not a lot, but not a lot is too much on this pitch. Flashed hard down to third man
on the toes, worked round the corner
fuller and straighter, that's the spot. Mid-off tidies up
drilled into the deep, but only a single. Ireland are batting within themselves for now, and rightly so.
on the toes, tapped to midwicket, and that's good running as the fielder rushes in from the deep
late outswing, but from a wide line. Flashed out to the sweeper on the cover boundary
that's the danger of the extra pace. Not a bad delivery, but full enough for O'Brien to put the full face through the line. Cover can't intercept
good riposte, keeping O'Brien honest
slower ball, and jabbed out to point
very full, very straight, hint of swing. That's the nut. Defended

huge wicket! Joyce has gone and Ashraful is celebrating wildly! Nothing shot, Joyce just turning the bat against the spin, took a leading edge and popped back to the bowler. The celebration was delirious. Bangladesh are all over this now!
forward and careful defence from White
Ashraful is really buzzing now, plenty of noise greets a forward defence
again White is popping forward and it runs off the edge fine of point for a single
nicely done from O'Brien, down the track and pushing a single to long-off. We hardly saw the Bangladesh batsmen leave their crease
quiet defence to end a big over for Ashraful
starts outside off, very low arm this time and O'Brien checks his drive, forcing it wide of point
White has barely picked his bat up so far, playing very carefully indeed
more resolute front-foot prodding from White
pushed back to the bowler, absolutely no intent to do anything more than block here
good line from Shakib, good length too and White isn't interested in anything bar survival
solid defence but Shakib and Bangladesh won't mind. Still, plenty of time left
O'Brien is doing what White hasn't managed yet, working singles nicely. This time with the help of inside edge
good grief! After all that blocking White decides it's time to unleash the reverse sweep, played it well enough but for a single seems a touch risky
oooh, uppish. Just too early on a drive and popped up towards cover
full toss but O'Brien misses out! Bunted it down the ground when, in less tense times, he might have thwacked it out the ground
turned neatly off the legs but a diving fielding cuts off a square-leg
another careful block from White
good running here allows O'Brien to pinch a single from a bottom-edged cut
wow, lovely turn but White is so intent on prodding defence that he's nowhere near it
lovely bowling again, drift, turn and bounce straight past a tentative, hanging defensive prod
touch more air on this and leg-sided too, but White just puts a bat in front of it and pats to the bowler
finally he gets the single, pushing carefully into the leg side
brilliant over ends with a slides that, er, slides past O'Brien's outside edge
another very cautious defence from White
it's either block or reverse-sweep from White, what an odd combination. Plays it nicely, fine and only some sharp boundary fielding prevents four
pushed firmly back to the bowler who scoots around to field
just a hint of width means O'Brien can cut, thoughts of two but only one available to deep cover
with no reverse-sweep on show it's simple defence
back to reverse-sweep mode. This is puzzling. Doesn't get much of it either
a little bit short but Shakib finding turn, O'Brien watches it very carefully onto to the bat as he cuts for one
White hanging leg side of the ball, make sure he doesn't play around his pad in defence
haha, it's that reverse sweep again! This time gets a very full connection - going with the spin -and sends it speeding to the fine leg rope
heave-ho but nowhere to go. That's the last rhyme I try, I promise. White aimed a huge slug across the line, tempted by the flight, but couldn't connect
after all that merriment it's back to disciplined defence
careful, cautious, resolute defence to finish another good Shakib over
O'Brien on the cut, he's played it well all innings, but picks out point here
on the cut again and this time pierces the infield to collect to deep point
worked to leg, but finds the infield

Ashraful is dancing again! You'd think he's just won the tournament. As it is he snared White who played back to a ball he should have got forward to. Hung his bat out in defence and it spun back past the inside edge onto off stump
tossed up and pushed out on the leg side by the second O'Brien - Kevin
Kevin, as he'll now be called, cuts this firmly out to deep point where some sliding fielding gives even more for the crowd to shout madly at
Shakib is less than impressed as Niall shoves this out to deep cover
Shakib is annoyed again, with himself here as this slides down the leg side. Slip in place, by the way
neatly played, Kevin getting deep into his crease and clunking down the ground
worked into the leg side, K O'B trying to give himself room which Shakib won't offer
again this is blocked off the front foot
solid defence. He looks a solid sort of fellow
full toss, O'Brien steps out to meet it and thumps a single down the ground to bring up the 100
boom. Kevin O'Brien is a big lad and got everything behind this cut shot, mullering it to the rope at point
follows the boundary with a well-placed single, good stuff here
Niall gets very deep into his crease, watches the spin and helps it on its way for a single around the corner
touch short and O'Brien gives himself room by hanging leg side of the ball before bringing down his big bat and clumping to point
Niall is the more dexterous of the two and opens the face nicely to pinch a single behind point
pushed down the ground for a single. Good over that for Ireland
touch short from Shakib and it would have been costly but for some excellent diving fielding at midwicket as K O'B slugged it to leg
careful, soft-handed defence back to the bowler
good shot for none  here, O'Brien getting inside the line and punching a drive to cover

what a catch! Get the celebrations going again, Tamim is the man! Niall O'Brien tried to chip a single to square leg, got too much on it and Tamim, haring in from the boundary, dived forward full length to scoop the ball inches off the turf. Crucial wicket that, could be the one that takes the game
nicely bowled, touch of air, good line too and O'Brien can do nothing but block
Shakib screams at himself for landing this too short. It allowed O'Brien to cut firmly out on the off side
this seems to slide on with the arm past the outside edge
full toss that's smacked hard at cover who dives to field superbly. Plenty of smiles and back-patting from the Banglas, they are alive here
Ashraful has a huge appeal as Botha is struck on the pads, not out though
quietly pushed into the off side
some width allows Botha to swing his arms through the line but no timing at all
this pitches and burrows through, almost under Botha's bat
crowd getting even louder as O'Brien bottom edges a cut shot
this time O'Brien gets it away, needed plenty of muscle to get it down to long-off. No pace in the pitch at all
finally Botha lands firm bat  on ball, but Razzak fields smartly off his own bowling
worked neatly into the leg side but straight to the fielder
ooh, this is close but no review called for. Botha playing back and the ball slid through him, past the keeper too and ran away for four. Looked stone dead!
blocked into the off side to end an eventful over.
a leading edge goes into the off side but along the ground
on off stump, hint of turn and defended
goes for the big shot and clears long off with ease...he has some power behind him does O'Brien and that was just a clean swing through the line
onto the back foot and calmly punched out to deep cover...that's sensible play, Ireland need more of it.
short outside off but Botha picks out cover as he drives
slower through the air this time and it's pushed behind square on the off
close! Another leading edge as he tries to play to leg but it falls safely in the point area
forced through the off side
onto the back foot and played with a straight back to midwicket
tossed up outside off and flicked with a bit of style down to long on
full on leg stump and it takes the pad as O'Brien misses his attempted flick
touch short this time and O'Brien cracks it firmly to cover
is the momentum changing again? Botha picks his gap over midwicket and clears the infield with ease
whips this one along the ground to midwicket
heaves this through the leg side, less elegance than the first ball of the over and it came off the bottom of the bat

the counter-attack is on...width outside off and O'Brien throws everything at the shot which flies off a thick edge down towards third man. The fielder slides after it, but the momentum takes him into the rope
and another boundary, he's playing a blinder here, as he drives on the up over cover. Was given width by a flighted delivery and he didn't hold back.

almost a double-bouncer (he once got a Test wicket with such a delivery) and it barely reached O'Brien who was on the back foot but managed to get the bottom of the bat on it. Gets a single to long on for his efforts
on the stumps and tucked off middle down to long leg
back of a length on off stump, opens the face to backward point
lack of bounce again, it's on middle but Botha manages to work it through square leg
outside off, O'Brien on the back foot and drives to cover
short outside off and it's greeted with a short-arm pull through midwicket
hint of movement into the batsman and he defends to the off side
cut away nicely from just outside off, he waited and placed the ball through backward point
goes for the full inswinger and it almost works but Botha squeezes it down to long leg off the inside edge

We have review. O'Brien is struck on the pad as he plays across the line. It's a big appeal but given not out and Shakib makes the 'T' signal. Might be only clipping leg, which won't be enough and, in fact, it's fully missing the stumps. Good decision from Aleem Dar.
good follow up, beats O'Brien outside off with a hint of away movement and the batsman is annoyed with himself
full outside off and this time it's left alone...he has spare deliveries to play with
laces a strong cover drive when offered some width but picks out the man at cover
on the stumps and worked out to midwicket
slightly quicker on off stump and defended past slip
dragged down a little short which allow Botha to punch it off the back foot to long on
round the wicket, tossed up and O'Brien drives to mid-on
stays leg-side of the ball and opens the face to find a gap at cover
worked from outside off, with the turn, through midwicket...150 for Ireland. Countdown time.
worked from off the stumps out to midwicket
slower ball, Botha comes onto the front foot and he defends into the off side
very full outside off and he opens the face to guide down to third
gone! The game changes again. O'Brien can't believe what he's done. Dragged down by Shafiul, O'Brien's eyes lit up but he pulled it straight down the throat of deep square-leg
pushed across outside off, Mooney nearly chases it but leaves alone at the last moment
outside off again and left alone
round the wicket, dragged down short and dispatched by Botha who unleashes a strong square cut which whistles to the boundary before the cover sweeper could barely start chasing it

We have another review. Botha is struck on front of middle and leg as he plays forward. Has it straightened enough? My goodness me, that is as close as a review can come. It's the on-field call by a few millimetres. Nothing in it.
punched down to mid-on
on off stump and Botha pushes into the covers
pulled down short this time which gives him to cut out to deep cover
on off stump and it's pushes back down the pitch...it's been a good spell from Shafiul
tight on the stumps and he can't get it past the inner field on the off side
terrific yorker and well dug out from around leg stump, jabbed down towards mid-off and they scampered a quick single
full outside off stump, Mooney chases it without any footwork and doesn't make contact
oh dear oh dear, that's not good for Bangladesh as he loses his line down the leg side and it clips the pad then eludes the keeper
back on off stump and Mooney defends into the off side
full on off stump and it's played very late which sends the ball through third man and there's some excellent running
big appeal but looks like an inside edge on that as he plays forward...yep, bat first
defended into the off side, nice line from the offspinner
gone! Another careless shot from an Ireland batsman, but Bangladesh won't care how they get them. Was wide of off stump and he tried to sweep it and only managed to get a bottom edge into the stumps
not what Bangladesh needed at all...dragged down on leg stump and it's glanced very fine
on the stumps and worked out to midwicket
Shafiul strikes! Huge blow and that could be it, that must be it! The crowd are deafening. Full ball on leg stump and somehow Botha contrived to play around it
doesn't look like getting close to this. Full and quick, Dockrell poked, but the ball had long since passed him
bat on ball this time, but not a lot of it. Pushed gently to cover. Trent Johnston is going to have to do this alone
play and a miss! Again Dockrell doesn't look entirely sure of what's going on. Slower ball outside off and he was through his shot far too early. I say shot, it was more a poke
prod, poke, fence, Dockrell is playing all his shots here and not connecting with many. Bangladesh need a win and they're almost there
solid defence, finally, but that makes it a wicket maiden. Wonderful over from Shafiul when his team desperately needed it
careful defence from Johnston, eyeing the ball very suspiciously
turned off the pads for a single, but that leaves Dockrell with four deliveries, which can't be great news for the tourists
Dockrell is barely picking up his bat, instead gently defending
once again Dockrell is rooted to the crease in defence
Dockrell is away, touch too short from Shakib and it's swung down to deep square
ideal for Ireland, Johnston keeps the strike by nudging a single to midwicket. 35 runs will feel like 135 though

Shafiul does it again! Johnston has asked for a review but it looks gone, lbw prodding forward to a ball that nipped back. Yes indeed, time to celebrate, the review confirms the wicket. The light is disappearing now for Ireland
gets a wide delivery outside off, he bowled a few of those, stabbed away to deep point
turned away into space, looked like a couple was on but some chaotic calling meant only a single was taken
outside off stump and left alone. Shakib has cut a very serious figure all day and is ordering his troops around firmly between deliveries
play and a miss outside off
fuller this time, Rankin was hanging back and held his bat a long way out from his body. Didn't look like connecting
Dockrell gets very deep into his crease to push a single down the ground
again Rankin has played and missed outside off stump. Shakib desperate to finish it off
driven carefully to cover
Bangladesh throwing themselves around the field. Whipped into the leg side but smartly fielded
worked off the toes into the midwicket region
finally Rankin picks up a single, fiddling this around the corner
full from Shafiul, Rankin swishes and misses. Looks every bit the No. 11 he is
hint of swing here for the wild-eyed Shafiul, just tailed back into Rankin late
driven, firmly but without much timing and it dribbles wide of cover
slower ball well wide of off stump, too wide for the umpire's liking, in fact
banged in short and it loops slowly over Dockrell
nicely played here, worked off the pads down to deep square leg

that'll be that! Bangladesh have done it, Shafiul finishes with four as Rankin chips to short midwicket. The crowd go absolutely wild, as well they might. Halfway through the hosts were in big trouble after a shoddy batting performance but their bowlers have pulled off a vital victory
